2.comment: Robert Meachem totaled 2 receptions of 52 and 47 yards.

3.comment: Robert Meachem.    The Saints predictably stayed away from the run.

5.comment: Robert Meachem, who had his coming-out party, caught the game-tying score in the third quarter. He finished with 8 grabs for 98 yards.

6.comment: Robert Meachem, who had his coming-out party, caught the game-tying score in the third quarter. He finished with 8 grabs for 98 yards.

7.comment: Robert Meachem had both, though he finished with only 2 receptions for 10 yards.

8.comment: Robert Meachem alertly tackled and stripped Moore, taking the ball away and returning it for a touchdown. The play was reviewed for what seemed like 5 minutes, and it actually stood. Moore was touched down, but by his own teammate. Meachem was awarded with a defensive touchdown (not a receiving touchdown), to the behest of fantasy owners everywhere.    Like the Colts, the Saints are 12-0. As mentioned earlier, 4 of the past 5 teams to start 12-0 have gone to the Super Bowl.    Drew Brees was an amazing 35-of-49 for 419 yards, 2 touchdowns and the aforementioned interception. Five of his weapons caught 4 passes or more, including Meachem, who hauled in 8 grabs for 142 yards and another score aside from his fumble return. Meachem has been dominant the past few weeks and has finally emerged as the prospect the Saints thought they were getting in the first round in 2007. Brees' other targets:

15.comment: Robert Meachem (3-50).    Reggie Bush and Pierre Thomas were still out, but New Orleans didn't miss them.

16.comment: Robert Meachem caught just 1 pass for 55 yards, but it was the big play to put the Saints into scoring position on the final drive.

17.comment: Robert Meachem turned in a 36-yard reception to get them down the field, but Pierre Thomas was locked up in the backfield and Darren Sproles got nothing on a screen to stop the march.

23.comment: Robert Meachem didn't get a single reception. He was targeted 4 times. I'd say that Rivers has no chemistry with him, but Meachem was never good in the first place.    Ryan Mathews was out again, so

26.comment: Robert Meachem once again did nothing. Meachem was targeted only twice, and 1 of the instances was Rivers' interception. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

27.comment: Robert Meachem, who caught 3 balls for 67 yards. It seemed like the Chargers were determined to get the ball to Meachem in an attempt to stick it to the Saints. Before you get excited, however, Meachem was targeted only 5 times in Rivers' 42 attempts.

28.comment: Robert Meachem. Unfortunately for Rivers, Meachem dropped the ball. He could have easily run into the end zone had he came up with the grab, and that might have been the game-winning score because the Browns struggled to move the chains in the second half. Meachem didn't catch a single pass, further proving that he's a colossal waste of money - something that was incredibly obvious when the signing was made.    Rivers went 18-of-34 for 154 yards. Meachem screwed up on that 1 play, but Rivers made mistakes of his own. He made some poor decisions with some of his throws and was lucky he wasn't picked off a couple of times, though the wind and rain didn't help. Making matters worse, most of Rivers' yardage came on short dump-offs to

32.comment: Robert Meachem (3-37), Kenny Stills (3-25) and Brandin Cooks (3-17 receiving, 2-31 rushing) had minimal impact, while Marques Colston had zero receptions.
